page.title: 05Killerby Hall Sheep
page.content: Mr.Stobbs has 270 ewes and 8 tups.They are Mule and Masham Breeds.This spring the sheep had 470 lambs, an average of 1.8 lambs per ewe. The sheep are mated with the tups in{October}, are brought indoors in {December}until they lamb in{March. After the ewes have lambed they are kept in pens their tails are docked,then they are turned out to grass. The fat lambs are sold in{July and{August. In the first week of{June}the sheep are sheared. The fleece are rolled into balls and wrapped in a wool sheet which holds 40 to 50 fleece. They are sent to the Bradford Wool Marketing Board. Mr.Stobbs gets Â£2.50 to Â£3 per fleece.
